docs.snippet: American soldiers in the Army of Occupation are optimistic over the outcome of the peace negotiations and do not look for further trouble with the enemy, though prepared for eventualities, ac  cording to Major Gen. James W. McAndrews, General...
docs.lead_paragraph: American soldiers in the Army of Occupation are optimistic over the outcome of the peace negotiations and do not look for further trouble with the enemy, though prepared for eventualities, ac cording to Major Gen. James W. McAndrews, General Pershing's Chief of Staff, who returned yesterday on the Leviathan.

headline.main: SAYS GEN. PERSHING WILL RETURN IN JULY; Maj. Gen. McAndrews Declares Head of A.E.F. Will Not Leave France Till All Is Settled. LEVIATHAN BRINGS 14,300 A.R. O'Shanihan, Arriving from Uruguay, Says Trade of His Country Will Come Here.

docs.snippet: The Serbian sacrifice in the war is said by Dr. YOVANOVITCH, head of the Information Bureau for the Kingdom of the Serbs, Croats, and Slovenes in the United States, to have been one out, of every five persons in the country.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Serbian sacrifice in the war is said by Dr. YOVANOVITCH, head of the Information Bureau for the Kingdom of the Serbs, Croats, and Slovenes in the United States, to have been one out, of every five persons in the country.

docs.snippet: PARIS, June 15.--The memorandum of the German peace, plenipotentiaries, which is now made public, shows that the Germans attempted to pose as negotiators with equal rights in the Peace Conference, instead of as defeated foes, come to learn the...
docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS, June 15.--The memorandum of the German peace, plenipotentiaries, which is now made public, shows that the Germans attempted to pose as negotiators with equal rights in the Peace Conference, instead of as defeated foes, come to learn the character of the purishment they should undergo.

headline.main: GERMANS OBJECTED STRONGLY TO TERMS; Reply to Allies Showed They Thought Themselves Equal Negotiators. PROTESTS AVAILED LITTLE Final Answer from Council Gives Relief on Only a Few Points. GERMANS OBJECTED TO ALL PEACE TERMS GERMANS OBJECTED TO ALL PEACE TERMS

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, July 11.--The Industrial Workers of the World are trying to form a revolutionary marine transport workers' organization and have already extended their activities to a number of South American and European countries, according to a letter...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, July 11.--The Industrial Workers of the World are trying to form a revolutionary marine transport workers' organization and have already extended their activities to a number of South American and European countries, according to a letter submitted to the Department of Justice today.
docs.abstract: Plan for world tieup of shipping; documents examined by N Y S Legislative Com on Bolshevism

headline.main: PLAN TO STOP ALL SHIPS.; I.W.W. Moving for Revolutionary Marine Workers' Organization.

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, July 11.--An approaching packer domination of all important foods in the United States and an international control of meat products with foreign companies seems a certainty unless fundamental action is taken to prevent it, the Federal...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, July 11.--An approaching packer domination of all important foods in the United States and an international control of meat products with foreign companies seems a certainty unless fundamental action is taken to prevent it, the Federal Trade Commission declared today in its report to President Wilson on the "extent and growth of power of the five packers in meat and other industries."
docs.abstract: Report to Pres Wilson shows fear of food corner by 5 big packers, says law is inadequate, and charges unfair competition, packers reply to charges

headline.main: FEARS FOOD CORNER BY 5 BIG PACKERS; Federal Trade Commission Sees International Control of Meat Threatened. SAYS LAW IS INADEQUATE Asserts "Big Five" Control 574 Companies and Produce or Deal in 775 Commodities. SEES UNFAIR COMPETITION Declares Chicago Dealers Are Interested in Banks, Carriers, StockYards, and Trade Papers. Interested in Meat Substitutes. Grows Fruit in Hawaii. Deal Also in Staple Groceries.
